definition[0]: to think that something is probably true, based on what you know
example[0]: There were many more deaths than was first supposed.
example[1]: There’s no reason to suppose (=it is unlikely that) he’s lying.
example[2]: What makes you suppose we’re going to sell the house?
explanation[0]: In more formal English, you can say it is supposed that something is true
example[3]: It is usually supposed that girls are less aggressive than boys
definition[1]: to expect that something will happen or be true, and to base your plans on it
example[4]: The company’s plan supposes a steady increase in orders.
